13  class KSMathIntegrator< KSMathSystem< XValueType, XDerivativeType, XErrorType > >
14  {
15  public:
16  KSMathIntegrator();

18 
19  public:
20  virtual void Integrate( double aTime,
21  const KSMathDifferentiator< KSMathSystem< XValueType, XDerivativeType, XErrorType > >& aTerm,
22  const XValueType& anInitialValue,
23  const double& aStep,
24  XValueType& aFinalValue,
25  XErrorType& anError ) const = 0;
26 
27  //the below functions may only be meaningful for explicit Runge-Kutta type integrators
28  //they are primarily intended for interpolation/dense output of the solution between mesh points
29 
30  /*******************************************************************/
31  virtual void ClearState() {};
32 
33  //returns true if information valid
34  virtual bool GetInitialDerivative(XDerivativeType& /*derv*/) const {return false;};
35 
36  //returns true if information valid
37  virtual bool GetFinalDerivative(XDerivativeType& /*derv*/) const {return false;};
38 
39  //these functions are provided if the integrator implements
40  //a method to interpolate the solution between initial and final step values
41  //only valid for interpolating values on the last integration step
42  virtual bool HasDenseOutput() const {return false;};
43  virtual void Interpolate(double /*aStepFraction*/, XValueType& /*aValue*/) const {;};
44 
45  /******************************************************************/
46 
47  };
